verses.kjv: After two days was the feast of the passover, and of unleavened bread: and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take him by craft, and put him to death.
verses.web: It was now two days before the feast of the Passover and the unleavened bread, and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might seize him by deception, and kill him.
verses.ct: It was 2 days before the Passover and the Festival of Unleavened Bread. The chief priests and the scribes were looking for a way to arrest Jesus through some trick and have him killed.

verses.kjv: But they said, Not on the feast day, lest there be an uproar of the people.
verses.web: For they said, “Not during the feast, because there might be a riot among the people.”
verses.ct: "Not during the festival," they said, "or the people might riot."

verses.kjv: And being in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at meat, there came a woman having an alabaster box of ointment of spikenard very precious; and she brake the box, and poured it on his head.
verses.web: While he was at Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at the table, a woman came having an alabaster jar of ointment of pure nard—very costly. She broke the jar, and poured it over his head.
verses.ct: While Jesus was in Bethany, eating at the home of Simon the leper, a woman came in carrying an alabaster jar of pure nard — an extremely expensive perfume. She broke the jar open and poured it over his head.

verses.kjv: And there were some that had indignation within themselves, and said, Why was this waste of the ointment made?
verses.web: But there were some who were indignant among themselves, saying, “Why has this ointment been wasted?
verses.ct: Some of those present were outraged. "Why would anyone waste perfume like that?" they said.

verses.kjv: For it might have been sold for more than three hundred pence, and have been given to the poor. And they murmured against her.
verses.web: For this might have been sold for more than three hundred denarii, and given to the poor.” So they grumbled against her.
verses.ct: "That could have been sold for more than 300 denarii and the money given to the poor!" They scolded her harshly.

verses.kjv: And Jesus said, Let her alone; why trouble ye her? she hath wrought a good work on me.
verses.web: But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why do you trouble her? She has done a good work for me.
verses.ct: But Jesus said, "Leave her alone. Why are you giving her a hard time? She's done something beautiful for me.

verses.kjv: For ye have the poor with you always, and whensoever ye will ye may do them good: but me ye have not always.
verses.web: For you always have the poor with you, and whenever you want to, you can do them good; but you will not always have me.
verses.ct: You'll always have the poor among you, and you can help them whenever you want. But you won't always have me.

verses.kjv: She hath done what she could: she is come aforehand to anoint my body to the burying.
verses.web: She has done what she could. She has anointed my body beforehand for the burying.
verses.ct: She did what she could — she anointed my body ahead of time for burial.

verses.kjv: Verily I say unto you, Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached throughout the whole world, this also that she hath done shall be spoken of for a memorial of her.
verses.web: Most certainly I tell you, wherever this Good News may be preached throughout the whole world, that which this woman has done will also be spoken of for a memorial of her.”
verses.ct: I tell you the truth: wherever the gospel is preached in the whole world, what this woman has done will also be told, and people will remember her for it."

verses.kjv: And Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went unto the chief priests, to betray him unto them.
verses.web: Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went away to the chief priests, that he might deliver him to them.
verses.ct: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the 12 disciples, went to the chief priests to hand Jesus over to them.

verses.kjv: And when they heard it, they were glad, and promised to give him money. And he sought how he might conveniently betray him.
verses.web: They, when they heard it, were glad, and promised to give him money. He sought how he might conveniently deliver him.
verses.ct: When they heard his offer, they were thrilled and promised to pay him. From that point on, Judas watched for the right moment to betray him.

verses.kjv: And the first day of unleavened bread, when they killed the passover, his disciples said unto him, Where wilt thou that we go and prepare that thou mayest eat the passover?
verses.web: On the first day of unleavened bread, when they sacrificed the Passover, his disciples asked him, “Where do you want us to go and prepare that you may eat the Passover?”
verses.ct: On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, when the Passover lamb was sacrificed, his disciples asked him, "Where do you want us to go and prepare the Passover meal for you?"

verses.kjv: And he sendeth forth two of his disciples, and saith unto them, Go ye into the city, and there shall meet you a man bearing a pitcher of water: follow him.
verses.web: He sent two of his disciples, and said to them, “Go into the city, and there you will meet a man carrying a pitcher of water. Follow him,
verses.ct: He sent 2 of his disciples ahead, telling them, "Go into the city, and you'll meet a man carrying a pitcher of water. Follow him.

verses.kjv: And wheresoever he shall go in, say ye to the goodman of the house, The Master saith, Where is the guestchamber, where I shall eat the passover with my disciples?
verses.web: and wherever he enters in, tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says, “Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?” ’
verses.ct: Whatever house he enters, tell the owner, 'The Teacher asks: Where is the guest room where I can eat the Passover with my disciples?'

verses.kjv: And he will shew you a large upper room furnished and prepared: there make ready for us.
verses.web: He will himself show you a large upper room furnished and ready. Get ready for us there.”
verses.ct: He'll show you a large upstairs room, already furnished and ready. Prepare the meal for us there."

verses.kjv: And his disciples went forth, and came into the city, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.
verses.web: His disciples went out, and came into the city, and found things as he had said to them, and they prepared the Passover.
verses.ct: The disciples left, went into the city, and found everything exactly as Jesus had told them. They prepared the Passover meal.

verses.kjv: And in the evening he cometh with the twelve.
verses.web: When it was evening he came with the twelve.
verses.ct: That evening, Jesus arrived with the 12.

verses.kjv: And as they sat and did eat, Jesus said, Verily I say unto you, One of you which eateth with me shall betray me.
verses.web: As they sat and were eating, Jesus said, “Most certainly I tell you, one of you will betray me—he who eats with me.”
verses.ct: While they were sitting at the table eating, Jesus said, "I tell you the truth: one of you eating with me right now is going to betray me."

verses.kjv: And they began to be sorrowful, and to say unto him one by one, Is it I? and another said, Is it I?
verses.web: They began to be sorrowful, and to ask him one by one, “Surely not I?” And another said, “Surely not I?”
verses.ct: They were deeply upset, and one by one they asked him, "It's not me, is it?" And another said, "Surely not me?"

verses.kjv: And he answered and said unto them, It is one of the twelve, that dippeth with me in the dish.
verses.web: He answered them, “It is one of the twelve, he who dips with me in the dish.
verses.ct: He told them, "It's one of the 12 — someone who is dipping bread into the dish with me right now.

verses.kjv: The Son of man indeed goeth, as it is written of him: but woe to that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed! good were it for that man if he had never been born.
verses.web: For the Son of Man goes, even as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for that man if he had not been born.”
verses.ct: The Son of Man will go to his death just as the Scriptures say. But how terrible it will be for the man who betrays the Son of Man! It would have been better for that man if he had never been born."

verses.kjv: And as they did eat, Jesus took bread, and blessed, and brake it, and gave to them, and said, Take, eat: this is my body.
verses.web: As they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had blessed, he broke it, and gave to them, and said, “Take, eat. This is my body.”
verses.ct: While they were eating, Jesus took bread, gave thanks, broke it, and handed it to them. "Take it and eat," he said. "This is my body."

verses.kjv: And he took the cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave it to them: and they all drank of it.
verses.web: He took the cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave to them. They all drank of it.
verses.ct: Then he took a cup, gave thanks, and passed it to them. They all drank from it.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, This is my blood of the new testament, which is shed for many.
verses.web: He said to them, “This is my blood of the new covenant, which is poured out for many.
verses.ct: He told them, "This is my blood of the new covenant, poured out for many.

verses.kjv: Verily I say unto you, I will drink no more of the fruit of the vine, until that day that I drink it new in the kingdom of God.
verses.web: Most certainly I tell you, I will no more drink of the fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it anew in God’s Kingdom.”
verses.ct: I tell you the truth: I won't drink the fruit of the vine again until the day I drink it new in the kingdom of God."

verses.kjv: And when they had sung an hymn, they went out into the mount of Olives.
verses.web: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.ct: After singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

verses.kjv: And Jesus saith unto them, All ye shall be offended because of me this night: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered.
verses.web: Jesus said to them, “All of you will be made to stumble because of me tonight, for it is written, ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.’
verses.ct: Jesus told them, "Tonight, every one of you will fall away because of me. For the Scripture says, 'I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.'

verses.kjv: But after that I am risen, I will go before you into Galilee.
verses.web: However, after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.”
verses.ct: But after I have risen, I'll go ahead of you to Galilee."

verses.kjv: But Peter said unto him, Although all shall be offended, yet will not I.
verses.web: But Peter said to him, “Although all will be offended, yet I will not.”
verses.ct: Peter spoke up: "Even if everyone else falls away, I never will."

verses.kjv: And Jesus saith unto him, Verily I say unto thee, That this day, even in this night, before the cock crow twice, thou shalt deny me thrice.
verses.web: Jesus said to him, “Most certainly I tell you, that you today, even this night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.”
verses.ct: Jesus said to him, "I tell you the truth: today — this very night — before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me 3 times."

verses.kjv: But he spake the more vehemently, If I should die with thee, I will not deny thee in any wise. Likewise also said they all.
verses.web: But he spoke all the more, “If I must die with you, I will not deny you.” They all said the same thing.
verses.ct: But Peter insisted even more forcefully, "Even if I have to die with you, I will never deny you!" All the others said the same thing.

verses.kjv: And they came to a place which was named Gethsemane: and he saith to his disciples, Sit ye here, while I shall pray.
verses.web: They came to a place which was named Gethsemane. He said to his disciples, “Sit here, while I pray.”
verses.ct: They came to a place called Gethsemane, and Jesus told his disciples, "Sit here while I pray."

verses.kjv: And he taketh with him Peter and James and John, and began to be sore amazed, and to be very heavy;
verses.web: He took with him Peter, James, and John, and began to be greatly troubled and distressed.
verses.ct: He took Peter, James, and John with him, and a wave of deep anguish and distress came over him.

verses.kjv: And saith unto them, My soul is exceeding sorrowful unto death: tarry ye here, and watch.
verses.web: He said to them, “My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here, and watch.”
verses.ct: He said to them, "My soul is crushed with grief — to the point of death. Stay here and keep watch."

verses.kjv: And he went forward a little, and fell on the ground, and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass from him.
verses.web: He went forward a little, and fell on the ground, and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass away from him.
verses.ct: Going a little farther, he fell to the ground and prayed that if it were possible, this hour might pass him by.

verses.kjv: And he said, Abba, Father, all things are possible unto thee; take away this cup from me: nevertheless not what I will, but what thou wilt.
verses.web: He said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible to you. Please remove this cup from me. However, not what I desire, but what you desire.”
verses.ct: "Abba, Father," he said, "everything is possible for you. Take this cup away from me. Yet not what I want, but what you want."

verses.kjv: And he cometh, and findeth them sleeping, and saith unto Peter, Simon, sleepest thou? couldest not thou watch one hour?
verses.web: He came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Couldn’t you watch one hour?
verses.ct: He came back and found them sleeping. "Simon, are you asleep?" he said to Peter. "Couldn't you keep watch for just one hour?

verses.kjv: Watch ye and pray, lest ye enter into temptation. The spirit truly is ready, but the flesh is weak.
verses.web: Watch and pray, that you may not enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
verses.ct: Stay awake and pray so that you won't fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak."

verses.kjv: And again he went away, and prayed, and spake the same words.
verses.web: Again he went away, and prayed, saying the same words.
verses.ct: He went away again and prayed, saying the same words.

verses.kjv: And when he returned, he found them asleep again, (for their eyes were heavy,) neither wist they what to answer him.
verses.web: Again he returned, and found them sleeping, for their eyes were very heavy, and they didn’t know what to answer him.
verses.ct: When he returned, he found them sleeping again — their eyes were so heavy they couldn't keep them open. They didn't know what to say to him.

verses.kjv: And he cometh the third time, and saith unto them, Sleep on now, and take your rest: it is enough, the hour is come; behold, the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.web: He came the third time, and said to them, “Sleep on now, and take your rest. It is enough. The hour has come. Behold, the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.ct: He came back a 3rd time and said, "Are you still sleeping and resting? Enough! The hour has come. Look — the Son of Man is being handed over to sinners.

verses.kjv: Rise up, let us go; lo, he that betrayeth me is at hand.
verses.web: Arise! Let’s get going. Behold: he who betrays me is at hand.”
verses.ct: Get up, let's go! My betrayer is here."

verses.kjv: And immediately, while he yet spake, cometh Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.
verses.web: Immediately, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, came—and with him a multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders.
verses.ct: The words were barely out of his mouth when Judas — one of the 12 — arrived with a large mob armed with swords and clubs, sent by the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders.

verses.kjv: And he that betrayed him had given them a token, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that same is he; take him, and lead him away safely.
verses.web: Now he who betrayed him had given them a sign, saying, “Whomever I will kiss, that is he. Seize him, and lead him away safely.”
verses.ct: Judas had arranged a signal with them: "The one I kiss is the man you want. Grab him and take him away under guard."

verses.kjv: And as soon as he was come, he goeth straightway to him, and saith, Master, master; and kissed him.
verses.web: When he had come, immediately he came to him, and said, “Rabbi! Rabbi!” and kissed him.
verses.ct: The moment he arrived, Judas walked straight up to Jesus and said, "Rabbi! Rabbi!" and kissed him.

verses.kjv: And they laid their hands on him, and took him.
verses.web: They laid their hands on him, and seized him.
verses.ct: The men seized Jesus and held him.

verses.kjv: And one of them that stood by drew a sword, and smote a servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.
verses.web: But a certain one of those who stood by drew his sword, and struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.
verses.ct: One of the bystanders drew a sword, struck the high priest's servant, and cut off his ear.

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Are ye come out, as against a thief, with swords and with staves to take me?
verses.web: Jesus answered them, “Have you come out, as against a robber, with swords and clubs to seize me?
verses.ct: Jesus said to them, "Have you come out with swords and clubs to arrest me, as if I were some kind of criminal?

verses.kjv: I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and ye took me not: but the scriptures must be fulfilled.
verses.web: I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and you didn’t arrest me. But this is so that the Scriptures might be fulfilled.”
verses.ct: Day after day I was right there with you, teaching in the temple, and you never arrested me. But this is happening so that the Scriptures will be fulfilled."

verses.kjv: And they all forsook him, and fled.
verses.web: They all left him, and fled.
verses.ct: Then every one of his disciples abandoned him and ran.

verses.kjv: And there followed him a certain young man, having a linen cloth cast about his naked body; and the young men laid hold on him:
verses.web: A certain young man followed him, having a linen cloth thrown around himself over his naked body. The young men grabbed him,
verses.ct: A young man had been following Jesus, wearing nothing but a linen cloth. The mob grabbed at him,

verses.kjv: And he left the linen cloth, and fled from them naked.
verses.web: but he left the linen cloth, and fled from them naked.
verses.ct: but he slipped out of the cloth and ran away naked.

verses.kjv: And they led Jesus away to the high priest: and with him were assembled all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes.
verses.web: They led Jesus away to the high priest. All the chief priests, the elders, and the scribes came together with him.
verses.ct: They took Jesus to the high priest, where all the chief priests, elders, and scribes had gathered.

verses.kjv: And Peter followed him afar off, even into the palace of the high priest: and he sat with the servants, and warmed himself at the fire.
verses.web: Peter had followed him from a distance, until he came into the court of the high priest. He was sitting with the officers, and warming himself in the light of the fire.
verses.ct: Peter followed at a distance, all the way into the courtyard of the high priest's residence. He sat down with the guards and warmed himself by the fire.

verses.kjv: And the chief priests and all the council sought for witness against Jesus to put him to death; and found none.
verses.web: Now the chief priests and the whole council sought witnesses against Jesus to put him to death, and found none.
verses.ct: The chief priests and the entire council were trying to find testimony against Jesus so they could execute him, but they couldn't find any.

verses.kjv: For many bare false witness against him, but their witness agreed not together.
verses.web: For many gave false testimony against him, and their testimony didn’t agree with each other.
verses.ct: Many people gave false testimony against him, but their stories contradicted each other.

verses.kjv: And there arose certain, and bare false witness against him, saying,
verses.web: Some stood up, and gave false testimony against him, saying,
verses.ct: Then some men stood up and gave this false testimony:

verses.kjv: We heard him say, I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and within three days I will build another made without hands.
verses.web: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days I will build another made without hands.’ ”
verses.ct: "We heard him say, 'I will tear down this temple made by human hands, and in 3 days I will build another one, not made by human hands.'"

verses.kjv: But neither so did their witness agree together.
verses.web: Even so, their testimony didn’t agree.
verses.ct: But even on this point, their stories didn't match.

verses.kjv: And the high priest stood up in the midst, and asked Jesus, saying, Answerest thou nothing? what is it which these witness against thee?
verses.web: The high priest stood up in the middle, and asked Jesus, “Have you no answer? What is it which these testify against you?”
verses.ct: The high priest stood up before the assembly and demanded of Jesus, "Aren't you going to answer? What do you have to say about these accusations?"

verses.kjv: But he held his peace, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him, and said unto him, Art thou the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?
verses.web: But he stayed quiet, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him, “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?”
verses.ct: But Jesus stayed silent and gave no answer. The high priest pressed him again: "Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed One?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus said, I am: and ye shall see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power, and coming in the clouds of heaven.
verses.web: Jesus said, “I am. You will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming with the clouds of the sky.”
verses.ct: Jesus said, "I am. And you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power and coming on the clouds of heaven."

verses.kjv: Then the high priest rent his clothes, and saith, What need we any further witnesses?
verses.web: The high priest tore his clothes, and said, “What further need have we of witnesses?
verses.ct: The high priest tore his clothes and said, "Why do we need any more witnesses?

verses.kjv: Ye have heard the blasphemy: what think ye? And they all condemned him to be guilty of death.
verses.web: You have heard the blasphemy! What do you think?” They all condemned him to be worthy of death.
verses.ct: You've heard the blasphemy! What's your verdict?" They all condemned him as deserving death.

verses.kjv: And some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to buffet him, and to say unto him, Prophesy: and the servants did strike him with the palms of their hands.
verses.web: Some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to beat him with fists, and to tell him, “Prophesy!” The officers struck him with the palms of their hands.
verses.ct: Some began spitting on him. They blindfolded him, punched him, and taunted, "Prophesy! Tell us who hit you!" The guards took him and slapped him.

verses.kjv: And as Peter was beneath in the palace, there cometh one of the maids of the high priest:
verses.web: As Peter was in the courtyard below, one of the maids of the high priest came,
verses.ct: While Peter was down in the courtyard below, one of the high priest's servant girls came by.

verses.kjv: And when she saw Peter warming himself, she looked upon him, and said, And thou also wast with Jesus of Nazareth.
verses.web: and seeing Peter warming himself, she looked at him, and said, “You were also with the Nazarene, Jesus!”
verses.ct: She noticed Peter warming himself, looked closely at him, and said, "You were with Jesus of Nazareth too."

verses.kjv: But he denied, saying, I know not, neither understand I what thou sayest. And he went out into the porch; and the cock crew.
verses.web: But he denied it, saying, “I neither know, nor understand what you are saying.” He went out on the porch, and the rooster crowed.
verses.ct: But Peter denied it. "I don't know what you're talking about," he said. He walked out to the entryway, and the rooster crowed.

verses.kjv: And a maid saw him again, and began to say to them that stood by, This is one of them.
verses.web: The maid saw him, and began again to tell those who stood by, “This is one of them.”
verses.ct: The servant girl saw him there and started telling the people standing around, "This man is one of them."

verses.kjv: And he denied it again. And a little after, they that stood by said again to Peter, Surely thou art one of them: for thou art a Galilaean, and thy speech agreeth thereto.
verses.web: But he again denied it. After a little while again those who stood by said to Peter, “You truly are one of them, for you are a Galilean, and your speech shows it.”
verses.ct: Peter denied it again. A little later, the bystanders said to Peter, "You're definitely one of them — you're a Galilean. Your accent gives you away."

verses.kjv: But he began to curse and to swear, saying, I know not this man of whom ye speak.
verses.web: But he began to curse, and to swear, “I don’t know this man of whom you speak!”
verses.ct: Peter began to call down curses on himself and swore, "I don't know this man you're talking about!"

verses.kjv: And the second time the cock crew. And Peter called to mind the word that Jesus said unto him, Before the cock crow twice, thou shalt deny me thrice. And when he thought thereon, he wept.
verses.web: The rooster crowed the second time. Peter remembered the word, how that Jesus said to him, “Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.” When he thought about that, he wept.
verses.ct: Immediately the rooster crowed a 2nd time. Then Peter remembered what Jesus had told him: "Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me 3 times." And he broke down and wept.
